slideInfo.title: Turn a simple sentence into a complex sentence.
slideInfo.info:
I’m going to the mall.

Although I’m going to the mall.

Although I’m going to the mall, I have to leave early to finish my homework.

pButton.Name: Definition
pButton.popInfo: Simple sentence (one independent clause) or compound sentence (two independent clauses) PLUS at least one subordinate (dependent) clause.

pButton.Name: Subordinate Words
pButton.popInfo: The following words and others like them prevent a clause from expressing a complete thought. Words that subordinate include: after, although, because, before, if, since, though, unless, when, where, while.
